Position: Head of Consulting (Information Security and Cybersecurity)
Content: Just started working for the company as a Business Unit Manager, with a focus on completing all consultancy assignments related to security and cybersecurity.Additionally serves as a business developer (pre-sales), looking for new business opportunities and, most importantly, developing business use cases that demonstrate how cybersecurity is an important component of a company's overall risk environment and should not be viewed as a cost but rather as an investment.

Head of CSOC. Responsible for the implementation of CSOC for the Ministries of Internal Affairs and Health, as well as the migration of Portugal Telecom's (Altice Portugal's) SOC. Administration of ITCenter CSOC and its customer base.

accountable for creating, putting into practice, managing, and assessing information security solutions and architectures. Endpoint security and DLP integration, infrastructure security, firewall systems, computer and network forensics, network security scans for PCI, SOX, and HIPAA requirements, NOC/SOC administration, DevOps, ISO 27001/27002, IT Risk Management and Disaster Recovery, Security Awareness, etc. were among the projects that were undertaken.

The duties of the Chief Information Security Officer included designing, implementing, managing, and offering expert advice on the selection, justification, implementation, operation, and assurance of group-wide information security controls, processes, and management strategies to uphold confidentiality, integrity, availability, and accountability, to protect company assets in accordance with relevant laws, regulations, and best practices. The position required leadership in areas of information security and business continuity, as well as the ability to collaborate well with business functions at all management levels in order to offer knowledgeable advice and direction on the standards for security controls and best practices.
